description:
Following the British victory in the First Anglo-Sikh War (1845 – 1846) the Lahore Durbar, the Sikh Government of the Punjab, effectively came under the control of the British East India Company. In April 1848, two British officers were sent to the prosperous south western city of Multan to take over the running of the province from its governor, Diwan Mulraj Chopra. They were murdered by soldiers of the city’s garrison, apparently acting spontaneously and without the prior knowledge of the startled Mulraj. Nonetheless, after some prevarication, he supported their actions, and thereby found himself the leader of a rebellion against the British.
There were few Sikhs in that part of the Punjab: the garrison was mainly Muslim, and the Mulraj was a Hindu. Because of this, the East India Company regarded the uprising as a purely local affair and sent troops to lay siege to Multan in the expectation that this would quell the rebellion. These included a large body of Sikhs, supposedly loyal to the British, under the command of Sher Singh.

It is now late October 1848. Coming to sympathize with the Mulraj’s grievances against the British and to appreciate how these are shared by the Sikhs, Sher Singh has changed sides.   His men have withdrawn from the siege and are marching north east towards the Punjabi capital, Lahore. Sher Singh’s father, Chattar Singh, has also rebelled against the British and is besieging the fort at Attock which guards the road to Afghanistan. Inspired by the defiance of Sher Singh and Chattar Singh, anti-British disturbances have broken out in towns and cities across the western Punjab.

In response, units of the British East India Company are assembling at Firozpur where they will become the “Army of the Punjab”, under the command of Lord Gough. Gough plans to march against Sher Singh before he is reinforced by Chattar Singh. The monsoon season has ended. Campaigning can commence. So begins the Second Anglo-Sikh War 1848 – 1849.

Into the Lion’s Mouth is a two-player beer-and-pretzels game which gives players the opportunity to replicate the British success in re-establishing control over the Punjab, or to re-write history by leading the Sikhs to victory.

—description from the publisher

A game about replacing your defiled rug.

It Really Ties The Room Together is a postcard game to be played with a standard deck of cards, inspired by The Big Lebowski, released in the Board Game of the Month Club February 2016 package.

There's a little tactical element of the placement of your cards, and there's also a cool card draft where you can just ditch the whole pile of cards and end the round, but at the heavy cost of going last next turn. All in all, a fun little game inspired by a fun little movie.

A dynamic push-your-luck dice rolling game.

The gameplay is so simple:

STEP 1 - Roll it.

STEP 2 - Get as high as you can.

STEP 3 - Pass it.

Filled with 55 coins and custom dice, and a pot, players compete to win the pot, and be the first to accumulate 24 coins.

In a near-future, slightly magicified version of our world, you've been selected as one of the contestants in a new livecast reality show. You’ll compete against other treasure hunters to explore ancient tombs ripe for looting.

But to up the stakes, the producers have rigged a series of demolition charges and given some control of them to the contestants. Time is running out, and no one knows when the roof might cave in.  Will you thwart your opponents and make it out with the most treasure ... or get trapped under a heap of dusty rubble?

With just a pencil, a print-and-play game sheet, and 2d6 for each player, you can play in person or over a video call.

The game plays in phases, and players play out each phase in the dark catacombs simultaneously and secretly, keeping their progress hidden.  They move around the catacombs and roll their dice to unearth treasure, all while trying to avoid (or confront) their opponents.  Looted treasures are kept secret, but after each phase players announce their positions and collapsed spaces on the map.

With your trusty GLM™ helping stow your treasures, you just might be able to snag the most loot.  Oh, and getting out alive would also be nice.

The stolen jewels must be returned to the princess! To do this, Raffi Raffzahn makes his way through the forest to the mysterious castle of the wizard bear — but the little dragon runs the risk of being turned into a piggy on every space.

Raffi Raffzahn is a magical-magnetic memo game.

—description from the publisher
Welcher Dino leuchtet da? is a children's game that in English is named Which Dinosaur Shines Here?

A reimplementation of Muumi viidakkoseikkailu and Coral Reef, Etsi ja löydä Safariseikkailu is a game of fast reactions that has the players flipping two cards and trying to find the animals depicted in the cards from the board as soon as possible.

First player to find both animals scores a point, five points wins the game. Some rounds reward players with camera tokens and it's also possible to win the game by collecting two camera tokens.

Bollwerk 178 is a Chess-like complex strategy game for two players.

Each player has 20 strong pieces and 25 supplementary stones at their disposal. The game is played on a board with 178 squares. The game board is in a constant state of change due to the supplementary stones.

The goal of the game is, occupying the opponent’s end field with a piece or a bomb. Whoever captures all his opponent’s pieces or immobilizes their opponent also wins.

On the board there is enormous potential for attacks, sheer unlimited possibilities for various positions, countless options for the next move, as well as an incredibly wide range of defense strategies.

—description from the designer

It is a card game. You have to collect a set of cards to win.
At your turn you can use some cards to block your opponents and obviously play some cards that free yourself if you are previously blocked.

The game is based on the novel of Geoffreoy de Pennart.

Hot Sauce by Kenneth Thompson. Ken always has a bag of tricks and this one was in the form of about 20 Taco Bell hot sauce packets. He had a neat domino feel tile laying abstract game in which Ben and Jason tightened a wee bit. In the end it's two things: 1) a full game made out of 7 cards or 2) a rule card that you can take with you to your favorite taco restaurant. Both have their perks.

—description from the publisher


A 2-4 player game that is played with sauce packets.

Shuffle the packets and place them into a pile of face-up and face-down packets. TAke the top 2 packets off the pile and place them in the center of the table, face-down next to each other.

Players will take turns drawing a packet from the top of the pile(any one that isn't covered by another packet) and then either 1) placing it in front of them for final scoring, or 2) placing it onto the center of the table so that it connects to a minimum of two other packets. After placing it, the player must flip over a packet that is touching it.

The game ends when the last packet is placed. Players score points for the packets in front of them. Each packet is worth 1 point for each face-up matching packet on the center. If there are no matching packets in the center, packets are -1 each.

Nuclear Packets do not score for players, but are wild in the center. They count as the type of any face-up packet that they are touching.


Released in the March 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Keresis is a strategic game: A mix of exploration, territory control and resource management. Each player takes the lead of an ancestral tribe and faces his opponents to become the master of the four elements.

The chaotic world of Keresis is about to collapse. To save your tribe, you must find a way to reach the lost shrines. As an explorer, you have a special ability and can unlock new powers later during the game. A shaman and some of your fierce warriors will join you in this unique adventure! Dangerous events may occur at any time during your expedition: Will you play it safe by following well known paths or will you put yourself in danger by exploring uncharted territories? The decision is yours!

Each player takes a turn to play and execute some of the following actions: 
Explore
Collect movement points and explore the map / Lay hex tiles and connect them to create paths to follow.

Gather/trade resources
Collect and use the available resources at your disposal: Energy, element stones and powerful action cards.

Control territories / Battle
Use element stones to deploy some of your warriors or expand your domination by invading enemies territories.

Summon your shaman
Protect your territories, rotate them or unleash the mysterious powers contained in the shrines.

Place your amulets
Each amulet placed on a shrine will bring you one step closer to victory! But it won’t be easy: Each territory is only associated with one shrine. Controlling the right kind of territory is key for placing your amulets!

Will be declared winner the first player to place an amulet on each of the four shrines OR the player with the highest score at the end of twenty-four rounds.

UNIQUE GAME FEATURES:
- 2 difficulty levels: Start as a disciple and become a tribe leader! The adaptable rules set offers a challenging and unique game experience for beginners and experienced players.
- Play in team 2 vs 2 with 4 players (Alliance & Betrayal mode).
- 2 modular board games and 60 unique hex tiles offer near infinite map layouts: You will need to use a different strategy and adapt it each game.

—description from the designer

Sky Towers is a family-friendly competitive card game for 2 to 4 players about building towers that add up to 21 with cards numbered from 1 to 10. Each card has an effect or placement restriction that will help you gain cards from other players, speed up construction, add to your neighbor's towers, peek at the deck, allow you to build any card, etc. In team mode, the effects are useful for exchanging cards between team members.

The only building restriction is that cards cannot go over 21 and you cannot build tower cards that match your neighbors' topmost card on their nearest towers to you. Nobody in your city wants to be a copycat.

Completed towers gain you points based on the number of kites on the card, with lower-value cards scoring more points. Completed towers and other actions may award you a bonus worth points at the end of the game. Cards in your hand and unfinished towers do not score.

Race to build the perfect city until the deck runs out, and enjoy building towers from around the world on top of other towers from around the world.

—description from the designer

Das NEINhorn, based on the children's book of the same name, features a spoiled unicorn who decides to take off from its family one day, eventually joining forces with a special raccoon (the "WASbär"), a strange dog (the "NahUND"), and an extraordinary princess (the "KönigsDOCHter").

In this quick-playing card game, players take turns revealing a card, then immediately saying the word that matches the revealed animal — but this won't necessarily be easy...

A yummy deduction game that will fill your belly.

In May, we went with a candy theme. The film was one of the cultiest of the cult films, yet also a family film based on a non-cult book... Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

Matthew O' Malley (Diner, Between Two Cities, Knot Dice) and Peter O' Malley designed Scrumdiddlyumptious, a deduction game that uses candy as its pieces! It's pure confection. I mean pure perfection. Or pure imagination? Anyway, it's so good, especially when you can eat the candy. :)

The art was completed by my daughter Beatrix Tagmire and son Leon Tagmire. It felt too fitting to not have kids do the artwork.

—description from the publisher


You actually play with real candy. Players grab handfuls of candy with different types (different colors, different brands, etc), and hide their stash from the other players. They then take turns using powers described on the card trying to get another player to eat pieces from their stash. The last person with candy still in their stash wins. But is losing really so terrible when it means you get to eat all that candy?


Postcard released in the May 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Tommy is a young detective who specialized himself in very peculiar cases.
Despite his age, he is not afraid to explore old abandoned castles, armed only with a camera, looking for scary ghosts. However, the ghost Tommy is looking for is very shy. Therefore, it tries to deceive the young detective with tricks.

Players reveal a trick card, which depicts a different trick among 4 kinds (visual, linguistic, logical, numerical). To solve it, players have to compare the revealed card with the trick deck’s top card. Only the fastest player will be able to catch the right object.

—description from the publisher

A drafting game about sharing things up.

Cult Film Postcard Game: The Time Warp, inspired by the cult classic The Rocky Horror Picture Show. It was designed by Dead of Winter’s Jonathan Gilmour and Curtis E. Clark.


Postcard released in the July 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


GOAL
Make the best 5 card poker hand out of your six cards after 3 rounds.

SETUP
Shuffle the deck and deal 3 cards to each player. Place the remaining deck in the center within reach of all players.

GAMEPLAY
Perform the following steps in order (each step consist in a specific way of drafting, drawing or playing cards):

     It's just a jump to the left
     Then a step to the riiiiiiight
     With your hands to your hips
     You bring your knees in tiiiiight
     But it's the pelvic trust
     That really drives you insaaaane
     Let's do the Time Warp again


GAME END
After three rounds, players will reveal their hands, comparing to see who has made the best 5 card poker hand.
They have Time Warped the best.

In Free Radicals, players take control of one of ten fully asymmetrical factions, each with its own path to earn resources, power, and the knowledge stored in the "Free Radicals", which are giant mysterious objects that appeared around the world, causing a huge evolutionary leap in technology. You might play as the merchants, using action points to travel to different markets, and grow in influence and efficiency; the Couriers, using your drones to pick up and deliver valuable goods; the Entertainers, using card placement and abilities to maximize powerful abilities; or one of seven other entirely unique factions!

Players also interact through the main board, where they can visit each other's buildings and try to unlock the technology in one of the free radicals. You can even help your opponents' research in return for influence and other rewards!

—description from the publisher

Mocarstwa is a strategic game with elements of the economy, the action of which takes place in 18th-century Europe.

It introduces us to the political and economic realities of that period, allowing us to play the role of the ruler of one of the nine powers: Poland, France, Spain, Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, Sweden, Russia or the Ottoman Empire.

The player can command an army, develop his empire and conduct political negotiations with other players. The goal is to gain control over most of Europe.

This second extended edition adds:

     new game mechanics based on Combat Cards eliminate the randomness of the game and significantly accelerate its course
     new scenarios, also in solo mode
     Power Cards that give each ruler individual options
     additional types of troops

Factory Floor is a light weight, polyomino (tetris-tiles) placement board game for 1-4 players.

As a fresh faced factory builder your tasked with building the most productive facility using the limited space provided in the most effective way possible. Using production facilities and quality control to increase the overall output of the factory, further increases to your output is made by the hiring and allocation of workers

Each player starts a with a floor space of 12x8 which can be make more difficult with the inclusion of column pieces. Each then takes turns selecting tiles or hiring workers to make the very most of their floor space and labor pool

After 5 production phases, and just one work week, the player who has managed to create the greatest output is named the manufacturing mogul supreme.

—description from the designer

STRANGE STUFF IS HAPPENING ALL AROUND US, LET THE CARDS BE OUR GUIDE! 
The Miri is a cooperative storytelling game where players contribute image cards to a storyteller to interpret. Players roleplay through those interpretations, using their own cards and rolling a 12-sided die to influence what happens in the story.

Players begin the game choosing one of the 18 Aspect Cards, becoming that character in story. Do you want to use muscle like The Warrior, or perhaps your intellect, like The Scientist. Are you more in tune with something spiritual, like The Shaman? There are many ways to play it!

Card by card, the story unfolds...

Each round, the storyteller lays contributed cards, as well as a few unknown cards, in a face-down spread. The reading of the images is performed similar to how a fortune teller would read Tarot, with images deriving meaning, and the orientation of the cards mattering. "Ordered" cards (correctly viewed) add positive events to the story, and perilous events happen when cards are "Mirrored" (upside-down).

During the reading of a spread, players are given the opportunity to say what they would like their character to do, and roll the die to see if their actions were successful. If players are successful, they may begin to turn cards in the spread to become ordered. A spread containing an Ordered Mind (blue), Body (red), and Spirit (green) card is considered a success for The Miri, and flips the next of five Suspense tiles in favor of The Miri.

However… Being unsuccessful in Ordering the cards allows the dark forces known as Ichor to get its clutches on the story! If all three Clutches of Ichor tokens are placed on the cards in the spread, you flip the next of five Suspense tiles back over in favor of Ichor.

If all five Suspense tiles show "The Miri", you WIN and conclude the story with a victory for the players! ...Unless the story was lost to the Clutches of Ichor!

—description from the designer

Endangered World is strategic, family-friendly board game designed for 2-4 people ages 8+.

Players take turns drawing number cards, which denote spaces on the 10x10 grid on the gameboard. On the board are 15 adorable animal figures of different sizes, as well as 20 "Twists & Turns" cards that can really throw the game for a loop.

On each turn, the player decides how to use their resources. How much do they want to invest in a certain animal? Do they want to play a Defender token to protect their surrounding resources? Or maybe a Bomb token to destroy their opponent's resources? The person with the most resources on an animal saves it, and the person who saves the most animals in the end is the winner!

Viscera is a fast paced tabletop game made by Chris Robert and Cole Basaraba where two to six people buy items, roll dice, and hunt monsters of varying mythologies to become the land's greatest hero.

Player can acquire cards and gems to prepare for a monster hunt. Players will roll and reroll dice as they try to inflict enough damage to defeat the monsters. The monsters are kept as trophies for Victory points.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins!

-description from designer

It’s Kids vs. Adults in a head-to-head challenge on everything Disney! Relive your favorite Disney moments and create some new ones as Kids and Parents compete in a game of Disney questions and challenges. Take on multiple question categories such as “Name The Character”, “Disney Detective”, “Wild Card” and more. The first team to get both mover pieces across the board wins the game!

—description from the publisher

You are crazy! With gestures, show your crazy teammates like you who you think you are, but be careful, the doctor is watching you!
In I am a banana, the players point to a doctor. He puts on his glasses and then receives the Doctor cards from 1 to 7. The other players are crazy and play as a team against the doctor. Each crazy player receives a banana card numbered from 1 to 7, which corresponds to a picture. This picture shows you what you are getting into.
For 90 seconds you must find the "pathology" of one of your teammates before the Doctor unmasks you. He is watching you! He too wants to find a maximum of madnesses by putting down his Doctor cards, because for each madman he will have burned, he will be the only one to score points!

—description from the publisher (translated)

In Potions and Profits, you are a Wizard representing one of many pharmaceutical corporations looking for new Potions to invest in.

In this bidding, bluffing, and auction based game, competing Wizards will try to outbid you for Potions as you balance both your Stock Value and your Public Relations. The most profitable Potions tend to be the least ethical but that doesn’t matter so long as your investors are happy and not too many protesters are kicking down your door.

Become the most profitable corporation by either monopolizing one type of Potion or by simply having the best pharmaceutical line around.

In the year 2025, the telepathic monster Broodmaster Magnalux has established a base on Earth’s moon. As the human player, you must alert humanity to the threat, and rally armies, navies, and air forces against the alien menace. As the Broodmaster player, you must subvert the Earth, using your mind control to gradually take control of Earth’s most vital defenses.

Invasion of the Brood is an asymmetric 2-player strategy game about the conquest of planet Earth. Humans must unite, then defeat an alien threat. In opposition, the Broodmaster Magnalux seizes control of our very minds, spawning its minions across the globe.

Will humanity pull together to stop this alien invasion, or will the sinister Broodmaster take over the world? You decide!

Roberto's take on the Sport of Kings - Horse Racing - is a simple, statistically based sports simulation allowing gamers to replay historical Flat, Jump, Steeplechase, and Harness races from 1900 into the 21st century.

Horses are classes A through H and may also have a set of asterisks indicating their chances of winning close races.

The races are run over a number of steps (usually 6 or 10), and each step consists of a dice roll cross referenced to a set of charts which indicate how each horse fares against the pack.  Additional rolls are required to determine accidents, and close races lead to an additional "photo finish" step.

"Can You Survive 2020?" is a silly game for serious gamers. There is some strategy involved, and also a ton of chaos. Written by Gen Z parents living the COVID life 24/7 with Gen Z kids, the game exudes its own version of twisted humor.

Players initially race around the board, buying up stock before the value collapses. While doing that, you are spreading a virus wherever you go, drawing notification cards (made from the insane things that have happened in 2020), and collecting toilet paper and homeopathy pills. Eventually, as spaces get quarantined, players are forced into the Bunker for the Lockdown Round.

At any point in the game if any one player dies from too much virus the game ends. You have to work together to stay alive, while also trying to get the most resources. Once the game ends players count their resources to win "Trophies." Trophies can be won for things like holding the most stock, the most toilet paper, AND (of course) a "Participation Trophy" for the individual who loses so - trophies for everyone!

The player with the most trophies wins the game.

—description from the designer

You are a duke trying to build up your lands where the monstrous fachan is rampaging. But he is just lonely. Your cunning plan is to make a false bride for him just behind your rivals’ buildings. The love-struck monster will crash through the other dukes’ lands, destroying them, while you continue to build up yours!
 Marry the Monster is a game in which each player scores points by building structures and having them remain until your next turn without being destroyed by the monster. Turns are taken by playing cards, and there is no upkeep phase – play simply continues until there is a winner.

A semi-statistical replay game allowing gamers to replay entire tournaments or individual bouts.

Historical fighters are rated for Boxing Quality, Knock Outs For and Knock Outs Against, and Fight Quality.

With just a couple of dice rolls players can determine a KO or points victory with the Basic Game.  Or they can go round by round, blow by blow, the dice and charts telling a compelling story of control, ascendancy and power.

Like the arcade game PAC-MAN the Card Game is a colorful and simple game with mass appeal. It's a brand new PAC experience that will quickly get you hooked.

Contents:

108 cards (across 2 decks)
There are three ways to play:

Stage 1: Beginners | 2–4 players | 5–15 min

Your aim is to get the most points without being knocked out by ghosts. Fruit and PAC-dot cards are worth points; power up cards have special rules, like having two players swap hands; and three ghost cards will knock you out of the game!

Stage 2: Advanced | 2–4 players | 5–15 min

Mastered the Level 1 deck? Challenge yourself with the Level 2 deck, which has more ghosts and stronger power ups!

Bonus Stage | Up to 8 players | 15–25 min

In this version of the game, you can combine both decks to play with up to 8 players

Riddle Island is a original series of escape room type game based on Taiwan’s three different era of history. As you progress and solving riddles, you will slowly reveal the true stories lie under the surface…

1943A.D. Returning back to Takao, where you born and grow up, but this time is to find your missing lover. A letter, a notebook and a strange puzzle wheel, you receive these before your lover went missing.
Follow the clues and the track of your memories, can you find out where he is and the reason he left?

—description from the publisher

- What is Big Boy Throwdown?? -

Big Boy Throwdown is an award-winning card and dice game about a bunch of weirdos fighting each other.Play your cards, roll the dice, get even more cards and play your way to the top!

Set in the world between dimensions known as the Between-Zone, the first deck of BBT features 100 unique cards and over 80 characters, including Angry Eggs, Strange Salesmen, Cosmic Clowns, Friendly Frogs, Chicken Champions, Noble Knights, Sentient Squares, a giant green cat named 'Dr. Uncle' and more.

BBT is all the fun and variety of classic trading card games, easy to learn and straight out of the box!

- The Game -

Gameplay runs in a slick & quick combination of strategy & chance, with players using the cards in their possession to attack their opponents' cards.If a player destroys an opponent's card, they roll to draw a random card from the Deck. This is the only reliable way to keep getting cards.

All cards have their own unique stats and a variety of Effects, which twist the rules and vary wildly in power & utility.

Because of the sheer number of cards in this first Deck, you may very well play half a dozen games of BBT before you see all of the unique, comical, and wonderfully surreal characters that we've packed into this first installment.

- The Details -

Recommended game size: 2-6 players
BBT is really designed for groups of 3 or more players, but does work with two players. More than 6 players can play BBT at a time, but game time will be longer as a result.

Avg. Game Length: 5-20 minutes

Ages 12+

- The Makers -

BBT is a labor-of-love project by Clown Car Entertainment, a small group of artists and creators centered in Pittsburgh, PA.

The game was first created in fall of 2016 when the makers were in college, and quickly won the hearts of their peers who played it between classes and during get-togethers. We're eternally grateful for all of the support they gave us; it helped us turn sketches on index cards into a fully fledged game project that anyone can play.

Holding an ancient treasure map, you keep going deeper and deeper into the dragon’s cave, hoping to find the treasure that you’ve been dreaming for. In front of you, there are three caves, on of them lies the treasure, but be ware, if choosing wrong, you might awake the dragon and bring trouble to the team… The map doesn’t show you which is the correct cave, but there’s a hint in the room, now is time to you your most powerful weapon-mathematic and probability!

The Treasure Cave of Dragon is a exciting game with dice rolling and push your luck mechanic, there are three times of dice rolling to reveal the correct cave of the treasures in each round, the earlier the players decide which cave they go in, the bigger chance they will be wrong but more treasures they might find…
Are you brave enough to rush in recklessly? Or wait until the situation becomes clearer…?

—description from the publisher

Totally Terrific Trivia is a family trivia game consisting of 900 questions spanning six categories and one six-sided die.

The game can be played with by individuals or teams. The die is used to determine starting player, and afterwards the corresponding question on the trivia card for the category the player or team chooses. The player or team on the left reads out the question. If the player/team gives the correct answer, they keep the card; if not, it is returned to the box and play passes to the left.

The goal of the game is for each team or player to obtain one card from each category. When this happens, the succeeding team or player wins.

Includes: 900 Questions, 1 die, and rules

Players have to make a story by playing characters one next to the other.

Every  characters says something different and the combination can make odd and NSFW stories.

When seven character cards are played on a raw  the story is completed and the player that achieved his hidden goal is the Winner!

What about the others?

Well...Losers have to make amends.... with repentance cards!!!

Who are the characters?

Stegosandro, the Mayor of Lignano and other great characters made by the Famuos Youtuber and Artist Andrea Lorenzon. also known as "Cartoni Morti".

—description from the publisher

As a tour guide in Citytrip Brugge you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting famous buildings and musea, events, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Brugge is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 23 starting points and 44 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends after 15 turns. The player with the highest satisfaction score wins Citytrip Brugge.

— description from the designer —

In ãƒŠãƒ¯ãƒãƒª (Nawabari), the players compete over a series of rounds to score the most points.

Each round is composed of 3 or 4 turns, in which players will draft a card from a row.  At the start of each turn, some cards are turned face up and ordered by number.  The players each draft a card in the order of their tokens, from left to right, and the placement of these tokens on the cards from this turn will determine the turn order for the next round.

Once selected, a player takes the chosen card and places it in front of themselves. The cards have a number of attributes, such as odd/even number; terrain type; and card effect.  Some cards provide an immediate benefit; others allow conversions; and some are conditional effects.

At the end of each round, players will score for the current round's scoring card, and other scoring types. Afterwards, the players simultaneously choose one card from their tableau to keep, which also determines turn order for the next round.

The Where’s Wally Find It Fast game is a brilliant, fun, quick paced matching game! Pick a card that contains a multiple images of Where’s Wally and other general objects then roll the picture dice – find an image on the dice that matches one on the card to win the round. The player who finds the most matches wins.

-description from publisher's website

ï¼¤ï½’ï¼Žé‡Žå£ã£ã¡ (Dr. Nogucchi) ã©ããŸãƒ¼ã®ãã£ã¡ (Dokuta no Guchi) is a game from Japan which includes a model microscope. Players use the fake microscope to study specimens, looking for the cure, the silver bullet to cure a terrible disease (the game was first published in 2017!).

Players look through the microscope to identify different viruses. If a player is confident that they have the cure, they declare and gain 2 points if correct, or lose 1 pt if wrong. Other players can still find the cure and gain a point. The first to get to 5 points is the winner.

The specimens are card hexes with different combinations of microbes showing in each part. When a player peeks into the microscope, the card is rotated, so they only see a section at a time. Remember what you have seen in the scope is important to the game.

There are tokens for the microbes and for coloured test tubes of drugs. Players build up a collection of drugs and bugs behind their laboratory screen. When a player is confident they have the right combo to complete the cure, they can declare.
user summary

Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover two new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Aquatic and Hidden!

Tierra Feudal (Feudal Land) is a card game where we represent the leader of a noble house from medieval Europe. We are on a mission to develop our fiefdom better than anyone else through the recruitment of new vassals, the construction of buildings, the establishment of production improvements and, of course, the growth of our military defenses.

Starting from a few cards, we will have to manage the production of resources to be able to get better characters, buildings and nobles from the market that allow us to make more efficient and productive combinations of cards. We will have to carefully plan our acquisitions since the lack of chance in the game will place almost all the responsibility of defeat or victory on our decisions.

After the construction of a certain amount of buildings the game will end. The military and economic power, the productive capacities, the power of the church and the nobles under our vassalage will determine the victory points that we get and the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

This is a mystery game to move the story forward through conversation. At a friend's house at night, there is a suspicious person under the bed... What are the consequences for A and B, who both have their secrets?

publisher's summary

In this 2 player game, the player's adopt the roles of persons 'A' and 'B'. B is visiting A and stays in A's university room. But at night, they realise there is a suspicious figure under A's bed. B is alarmed, even more so by A's calm response.

During the game, the players converse, trying to get information to undercover the truth. The game has three main endings that can be reached, but the players each have secrets (hidden through QR codes), so the players cannot be sure how the game will end. This gives the game much replay ability, even if they do reach an ending.

Players get information from cards in the game, dependent on where they are in the room, or from keywords appearing in the talking. The players are allowed to reveal information, or hide, or even lie if they wish. The game may unfold as the players wish, or they be disturbed by the secrets revealed (the game is aimed at older players). Playing out the roles in different ways may make the endings change too.

Players will need access to some digital device to examine the QR codes in the game.
user summary

Really?! Think you know me? Guess again! is a family-friendly party game that is all about you, your friends, and your family. 
How well do you really know your family and friends? Will your friends & family be able to guess your answers?

EASY TO PLAY: Simply read the question card and choose your answer from a list of potential answers on the card. Mark your answer on your number dial while other players guess your answer marking their number dials. For each correct guess – return one ice piece to the tumbler. When all your ice is in—you win!

All components fit inside a 24oz tumbler - 6 number dials to mark your chosen answer, 60 sparkling play ice pieces for scoring, 100 conversation starter cards with over 500 answers and simple instruction sheet.

AWARDS & HONORS
Creative Child – 2022 Game of the Year Award
Tillywig Toy Awards - Best Family Fun

Intro:

     1934 on the flats of the California desert Drag Racing was born.
     1940’s-1950’s grew the popularity of illegal street racing among high-schoolers


Finding a quick thrill and showing off their cars.

     Mid 1950’s the first legal ¼ mile drag strip was built and the popularity grew.
     Today exists many different classes of professional drag racing from top fuel, funny car, pro-stock, and more…….with large purses to be won.
     Old Century Drag Racing captures the excitement in a quick easy head to head competitive match right on your kitchen table.


Gentleman/Ladies – Start Your Engines!

Object of the Game:
Compete in a one-time ¼ mile classic style drag race and be the first to cross the finish line, or a best out of three or five races for a more competitive race. Best out of three or five races is recommended.

—description from the designer

Small Ball is a two-player, push-your-luck dice game that celebrates the highly strategic style of baseball known as "small ball", which places an emphasis on manufacturing runs by way of single-base advancements and aggressive base running.

Teams are made up of nine unique dice that each reflect the typical characteristics of batters in a lineup, including the lead-off hitter who gets on base, the clean-up hitter who is capable of powerful extra-base hits, and the pitcher who can sacrifice a runner over.

â€‹Small Ball challenges teams to score runs by making tough, strategic decisions - when to steal a base, when to lay down a sacrifice, when to call the hit-and-run, and when to go to the bench for a pinch hitter - and implements a major rule change that makes decisions even more grueling.

—description from the designer

ï¼å¤©å‹•èª¬ï¼ (TendÅsetsu) (Geocentric Theory) is a game from Japan, with players sailing ships on a Flat Earth. The game title translates more literally as Theory Of The Moving Heavens. Geocentric Theory (often simplified as Ptolemaic Theory) puts the Earth at the centre of the Universe.

The players sail their ships on the oceans, searching for the treasure island of the Pirate King. But if they sail too close to the edge of the world, over they go!

The game includes an Armillary sphere to help the players navigate. There is a day phase and  a night phase. During the day, the navigator reads the winds and the waves, and at night, the stars. When an undiscovered island is found, players can search for clues to the location of the gold and silver treasures.

As well as the 20cm tall sphere, the game also has the sea in a box. When it is not their turn, a player moves the box around to bring the sound of the sea alive.
user summary

You've brought home a delectably devious box of chocolates. Upon opening, you discover a note!

"Thank you for choosing us for your chocolate eating journey! Enjoy our classic dark, milk, and white chocolates along with our new crimson chocolates, made from a mixture of rose petals and cocoa beans. Our chocolate boxes are known for being delectably devious, which is why you’ll find our chocolates individually wrapped and indistinguishable.

We’re positive you’ll want to get your favorites before anyone else does. For those with more adventurous palates, please enjoy the chocolate-covered vegetables also included. "

BitterSweet is a fast, two player game with elements of drafting, push-your-luck, and memory. Players compete to gather their favorites chocolates while avoiding those they might find unappetizing. Each round your preferences change, altering the dynamics of individual cards and what you want most!

—description from the designer

If you love Major League Baseball and think you know baseball better than anyone else, here’s your chance to prove it with the new MLB Baseball Trivia Challenge board game. To win, you’ll need more than baseball knowledge and luck on your side because strategy is what separates this unique trivia game from the pack. With 1,000 questions, every baseball player will have to be up to the challenge. For MLB fans who think they've got game, it's time to put on your cap, grab your bat, and knock it out of the park in the new Baseball Trivia Challenge.

Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt combines the power of play with hands-on learning and creativity! Collect golden coins in Jungle Treasure, act like a monkey in Island Race, or create their own game by making new rules! Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt is a great first game that grows with your child and encourages fine motor skills, imagination, social development, and more!
